channel.title: Rows and Columns on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Rows and Columns on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Adjusting Row Height and Column Width
item.description: When working with spreadsheets and adding data to rows or columns, you might need to change the height of rows or the width of columns. Sometimes, applying formatting on rows or columns means that the current height or width needs to change to show the data. Normally, users adjust row heights and column widths in a WYSIWYG environment using Microsoft Excel. But, with Aspose.Cells developers can perform these operations at runtime.

item.title: Copying Rows and Columns
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Introduction 2 Copying Rows and Columns with Microsoft Excel 3 Using Aspose.Cells 3.1 Copying Rows 3.2 Copying Columns | Introduction Sometimes you need to copy rows and columns in a worksheet without copying the entire worksheet. With Aspose.Cells, it is possible to copy rows and columns within or between workbooks. When a row (or column) is copied, the data contained in it, including formulas - with updated references - and values, comments, formatting, hidden cells, images and other drawing objects are copied too.

item.title: Grouping, Ungrouping Rows and Columns
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Introduction 2 Group Management of Rows & Columns 2.1 Grouping Rows & Columns 2.1.1 Group Settings 3 Ungrouping Rows & Columns | Introduction In a Microsoft Excel file, you can create an outline for the data to let you show and hide levels of detail with a single mouse click. Click the Outline Symbols, 1,2,3, + and - to quickly display only the rows or columns that provide summaries or headings for sections in a worksheet, or you can use the symbols to see details under an individual summary or heading.

item.title: Inserting, Deleting Rows and Columns
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Introduction 1.1 Managing Rows and Columns 1.1.1 Insert a Row 1.1.2 Inserting Multiple Rows 1.1.3 Deleting Multiple Rows 1.1.4 Insert a Column 1.1.5 Delete a Column | Introduction Whether creating a new worksheet from scratch or working on an existing worksheet, we may need to add extra rows or columns to accommodate more data. Inversely, we may also need to delete rows or columns from specified positions in the worksheet.
